Articles.Content:
I was just wondering what your favourite part is when you are building either space planes or rockets and why. It can either be a stock or modded part.

Mine would have to be a simple parachute because without it I cant get my Kerbals home!

Hopefully this post might introduce other players to parts they may have never used before ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Poodle Engine! It's very compact and it's an excellent space engine... It's been a while since I last used the nuclear engine so I can't call it the best overall vacuum engine but it's great for landing and generally moving around. I also like LT-2 Landing Struts because they aren't LT-1 Landing Struts.

Hhhmm... it is a tie between the LV909, docking port juniors, or struts once I have these Kerbins SOI is my oister.

My least favorite are the lifting engines minus the Rhino
I like the original landing wheels. So thin and small, but ridiculously strong :-)

For orbital stuff: LV-N Nerv. Much Isp, very efficiency, wow.

For spaceplanes: RAPIER. Buy one high speed air-breathing engine, get a rocket engine for free!
LV-N "Nerv" Atomic Thermal Rocket, using Ven's Stock Revamp; Kerbodyne KR-2L or Mk2 Lander Can in stock. (close tie.)
struts- if not for them nothing i ever built would be able to exist whole

![70px-Communotron_16.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/thumb/4/49/Communotron_16.png/70px-Communotron_16.png)

because it makes me sing :

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PHlcSwBsyks?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> or Mk2 Lander Can in stock.

Interesting, a lot of people actually don't like the lander can on the basis that's it dosn't fit in with other parts. Not criticizing you though.

Mine would be the Jumbo-64. Cuz it's orange.

By far and away the most useful part is still the humble Cubic strut.

 And for this it is my favorite part. All hail the Cubic strut!

![Cubic_Octagonal_Strut.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/3/30/Cubic_Octagonal_Strut.png)

RemoteTech's humble Reflectron DP-10 antenna. Short range, low power, on by default.

![antenna_dp10_B.png](https://remotetechnologiesgroup.github.io/RemoteTech/guide/parts/antenna_dp10_B.png)

The most vital, and therefore most often forgotten part of my uncrewed launches.

> 
> And for this it is my favorite part. All hail the Cubic strut!
> [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/3/30/Cubic_Octagonal_Strut.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/3/30/Cubic_Octagonal_Strut.png)

Indeed All hail the Cubic Octagonal Strut!

And for similar reasons, all hail the small nose cone!

These two parts with their ability to be radially attached adding attachment nodes without using any up make them some of the most useful parts imaginable. . . . the smallest circular RCS tank also has it, but I use it much less frequently.
The MK 1 Lander Can will always be my favourite. It looks quite cozy.
The Nuclear Engine. The fact that it could be your best friend or overheat your ship is sorta like my personality in real life.

The Nuclear engine. I've grown to appreciate the high Delta-V you can get from this thing more than the average player. Or the ISRU.

EDIT: Oh hi. How'd you ninja me by 3 minutes?

Because you're a skrub

Can I say my favorite forum user other then me is right above me?
You should, not to be full of myself or anything. *Go Nuclear!*
Get a room, you two. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Get a room, you two. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

LMAO! Fusion at its finest!

Assuming we're talking about stock parts, I think I have to go with the LV-909. That said, the Skipper (for undetermined reasons) also has a special place in my arsenal. I just have a fondness for those intermediate misfit engines.

Personally, my favorite part(s) are the KSP Interstellar Warp drives.

Sorry orbital mechanics, I've got places to go and things to do.

Sure I could do orbital transfers if I wanted to, but who likes waiting for transfer windows? Not me.
And my favorite is Okto2. I love micro-constructions and that one allows for some quite sweet miniprobes.

There's a little orange 2.5m engine from [SXT](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79542-1-0-4-SXT-Lack-s-Stock-Extension-N-1-and-Aero-update-SXT-20-6-05JUL15-KSC-v3) that I simply can't live without if I'm doing conventional landers.

Failing that, imma be dull and say airbrakes, because they save every mission every time.
I'm gonna have to say the OX-STAT solar panel since, after I unlock it, all my vessels have at least one.

> 
> By far and away the most useful part is still the humble Cubic strut.
>  And for this it is my favorite part. All hail the Cubic strut!
> 
> [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/3/30/Cubic_Octagonal_Strut.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/3/30/Cubic_Octagonal_Strut.png)

All other answers are incorrect.

The cubic strut is the mother of form and function.

All hail the cubic strut.
